content:
Work done at Google, in collaboration with Alexander Mordvintsev.
For an explanation of the project, see this web article or this paper.
description: A Biome Maker project using neural Cellular Automata.
title: Biomaker CA

content:

See the article.
description: An overview of isotropy and chirality on NCA.

description: Particle Lenia and the energy-based formulation.
title: Particle Lenia

content:
Work done at Google, in collaboration with Luca Versari and Alexander Mordvintsev.
Can we create feedforward neural networks that can both encode a target image and self-replicating with and without variation? Yes… after quite some observations…
Work published and presented at ALIFE 2021.
See the paper.
description: Creating a geneaology of neural networks encoding flowers.
title: Recursively Fertile Self-replicating Neural Agents

content:
Work done at Google, in collaboration with Alexander Mordvintsev, Eyvind Niklasson and Michael Levin.
Hijacking the behaviour of pretrained Neural CA with adversarial attacks.
See the Distill article.
description: Reprogramming Neural CA to exibit novel behavior through adversarial attacks.
title: Adversarial Reprogramming of Neural Cellular Automata

content:
Work done at Google, in collaboration with Alexander Mordvintsev, Eyvind Niklasson, Michael Levin and Sam Greydanus.
End-to-end differentiable Neural CAs capable of self-classifying the MNIST digit they compose.
See the Distill article and the colab for reproducing all the experiments.
description: End-to-end differentiable Neural CAs capable of self-classifying the MNIST digit they compose.
title: Self-classifying MNIST Digits

content:
Work done at Google, in collaboration with Eyvind Niklasson and Alexander Mordvintsev.
Meta learning a learning protocol that can be used instead of SGD, Adam, etc, to train feed-forward neural networks. At least, in theory.
See the Arxiv preprint and the code base. The code base contains colabs that show how to use it!
My first first author work. Very fundamental in nature and small in scope. Still, it is 9 pages long.
description: Meta-learning a learning rule for feed-forward neural networks that does not use gradients.
title: MPLP: Learning a Message Passing Learning Protocol

content:
My name is Ettore Randazzo. I am a Senior Software Engineer and Researcher at Google Research in ZÃ¼rich, Switzerland. Notable interests of mine are machine intelligence, complex artificial life, philosophy, ethics, logic and mathematics, gaming, music (including playing electric guitar and piano), and writing.
This website is currently research focused.
title: About

title: Growing Neural Cellular Automata
